sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_0586_til_post"> <x_0586_til_post action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <category display_value="Tricks">a8c6c0be1b8154908ed631d7dc4bcbef</category> <github_id>110</github_id> <github_url>https://github.com/iamkalai/SNTIL/issues/110</github_url> <message>SNC.CMDBUtil() is documented class with many functions to interact with CMDB. One function that does not seem to documented is 'isCMDB()'. You can pass tablename to the function and determine if the table is cmdb_ci or an cmdb_ci extended table. So you can quickly check if a table is cmdb_ci extended in a single line.  **Note:** Function does not work for CMDB (Base Configuration item) table.  ```javascript gs.info(new SNC.CMDBUtil().isCMDB('cmdb_ci_hyper_v_rpool_comp')); //returns true gs.info(new SNC.CMDBUtil().isCMDB('cmdb')); //returns false ```</message> <number>TIL0001114</number> <status>old</status> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2022-04-29 05:56:04</sys_created_on> <sys_id>cfc0895f2f43451051dad5f62799b657</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2022-05-03 07:11:44</sys_updated_on> <title>Check if table is CMDB</title> </x_0586_til_post> </record_update>
